title: Wallets - web3 Identities, Addresses, and Keys
body:
# anachronism

\[ uh-nak-ruh-niz-uhm \]

noun

1. something or someone that is not in its correct historical or chronological time, especially a thing or person that belongs to an earlier time

Being aware of anachronisms is important. Mainly because so many of the jokes in *Robin Hood: Men in Tights* are predicated on anachronisms. But also because an awareness of them can help prevent misunderstandings when they are used. As technology advances, anachronisms are inevitable as we attempt to fold new developments into our everyday language. The classic example is referring to a car as a â€œhorse-less carriageâ€.

When the term wallet is used in the crypto space, it is used anachronistically. The term gets the job done, but often leads to confusion about what exactly a wallet is or does. You may hear of web3 wallets, crypto wallets, bitcoin wallets, or ethereum wallets. When I was coming up, all the cool kids had a Fossil wallet, the long checkbook kind. I am writing an article on web3 and cryptocurrency, so clearly I did not have this kind of wallet. Iâ€™m pretty sure mine was Dockers brand. Definitely a trifold.

So what is this new kind of wallet exactly? A web3 wallet is software that allows you to interact with a blockchain. Remember, the blockchain maintains records. In a typical cryptocurrency setting, these records are records of transactions. A wallet allows you to initiate new transactions or new records on the blockchain. Of course these must be confirmed and validated by the network.

### Whatâ€™s in Your Wallet?

Web3 wallets do not hold or contain any cryptocurrency in the way that a traditional wallet would hold dollar bills. This is the main anachronistic misunderstanding that needs to be avoided. What they contain is the software necessary to interact with a blockchain network. They also contain two cryptographic keys. These keys are referred to as a Public Key and a Private key. These two keys are the most important thing contained in a wallet.

These two keys are the basis of the cryptography that secures the blockchain. The typical analogy used to describe them is a padlock and key. The public key works like an open padlock that you can give to anyone. You keep the private key, which opens the padlock. When they want to send you something, they secure it with the padlock. Once the padlock is secured the only way to open it is by using the Private key, which only you should have.

Both of these keys are very long and complicated alpha-numeric codes. For example, the public key for my Ethereum wallet is:

*0x14237e3a87BDa9FC4aD65ED2a2c9d43F535f73CF*

This code represents me on the ethereum blockchain. This is my address or identity. This key is public, so it is safe for anyone to have it. If someone wants to send me something, such as cryptocurrency or an NFT, they would send it to this address. â€œSending itâ€ would mean they use their wallet to create a transaction that assigns or records ownership of the item to my address. Now it is under my control. It has been locked with my public key. I can leave it locked or I can unlock it and send it to someone else. In order to unlock it, I would need the other thing inside my wallet - my private key. Private keys must be kept secure. Private keys are used to unlock the cryptocurrency, NFT, or other item and send it to a new address. The person who has the private key is the person who has control over the items associated with the paired public key. If your private key is lost, your ability to access and control any assets associated with your public key address is lost as well. Wallets help you keep up with these keys.

Within a wallet, you can create and manage multiple Public key / Private key pairs which operate like different accounts.

### Getting a Wallet and Some $Crypto

The first thing a person has to do to interact with the web3 world is to get a wallet. There are lots of options. Some wallets are designed to work with a single blockchain only, such as a bitcoin wallet. Other wallets, called multi-chain wallets, can interact with multiple blockchains and allow you to manage different types of cryptocurrencies through the same wallet interface. Once someone has a wallet, they can connect to an online exchange to trade their American dollars for cryptocurrency or an NFT. (I know I keep mentioning NFTs without explaining what that is. That will be the next article.) The exchange will then create a new transaction that assigns the agreed upon amount of cryptocurrency to the pubic key address of the wallet. It is now locked with that Public key. Once the transaction is added to the blockchain record, the person â€œownsâ€ or is in control of that cryptocurrency because they are the only ones who have the Private key to unlock it.

Remember, when this cryptocurrency is â€œsentâ€ to the new user, nothing is actually sent. This is often a hard concept for people to get their minds around, but an incredibly important one to understand. Instead, the record on the blockchain is updated to show that their address now controls the cryptocurrency they purchased. In this way, they own it. The cryptocurrency is not in their wallet, but rather their wallet contains the Private key that allows them to control the cryptocurrency.

## Types of Wallets

There are some important distinctions among the types of wallets out there. These distinctions are typically based on a trade off between ease of use and security.

### Hardware wallets are for Hardcore People

The first type of wallet to consider is a hardware wallet. This is the most secure type of wallet. These typically look like a USB thumb drive. The reason they are so secure is because they can be unplugged from your computer and buried in a coffee can in your yard. Without that device and the Private key it contains, no one is gaining access to your cryptocurrency. The downside is, if you forget where you buried the coffee can you arenâ€™t gaining access to your cryptocurrency either. These are also going to be password protected, so if you lose your password you wonâ€™t be able to get into the device to access any cryptocurrency associated with that wallet. There is also the possibility that the device itself could break, leaving you in the lurch without a way to access your cryptocurrency.

When you use a hardware wallet, you and you alone are in control of your Private key. Therefore, you and you alone are in control of your cryptocurrency. If something happens to your hardware wallet, there is no tech support to email or call to help you get it back.

### Custodial vs Non-Custodial

Most people are going to use a software based wallet that is accessed through a computer, web browser, or smartphone app. The major distinction between these types of wallets is Custodial vs Non-Custodial.

A Custodial wallet is a wallet that you access through a third party or custodian. These types of wallets are the most user friendly in the sense that if you have any issues or forget your password, there is normally tech support options and the usual password recovery options. The reason they are able to offer so much help is because they hold both the Public and Private key. This is helpful when it comes to ease of use, but it presents a major risk when it comes to security. The reason it presents such a security risk is because you are not actually in control. Instead, you are trusting a third party, which is really antithetical to the entire web3 ideal.

One of the biggest risks associated with Custodial wallets is for the custodian to go out of business. If you use a Custodial wallet through a company that goes out of business, you will most likely loose access to your wallet and the keys it contains. Without that private key, you cannot control any of what you own. This was a very common issue in the early days of cryptocurrency when companies would pop up and then fail quickly. In fact, there is quite a bit of cryptocurrency sitting on the blockchain, never to be accessed again because someone lost their access to their Private keys when a company went dark.

Another risk to Custodial wallets is the potential for censorship. If the third party custodian decides for some reason, political or otherwise, that you should not have access to your cryptocurrency, then they can cut you off by removing your access to the Private key controlling your cryptocurrency. 

Arguably the best happy medium between a hardware wallet and a Custodial wallet is a Non-Custodial wallet. These are sometimes referred to as Self-Custody wallets. These are wallets that only you control, so there is no third party who has access to your keys. These wallets live on your device. These can be desktop applications, web browser extensions, or smartphone apps. The main security risk is that the device they live on will typically be connected to the internet and therefore have the potential to be hacked. Also, the device could be stolen. These wallets are password protected. If you lose your password, there are some limited options for recovering the password. Typically password recovery is through a â€œseed phraseâ€ which is a long collection of random words that essentially function as a very secure backup password. If you lose your password and your seed phrase, you are toast. It will be very difficult to recover access to your wallet and the Private key it contains.

## That Thing They Keep Saying

If you wander around the crypto world for very long, you are sure to run into someone saying, â€œNot your keys, not your coinsâ€. This is a good summary of how to understand wallets and control of cryptocurrency. Wallets contain keys. These keys are used to control the cryptocurrency associated with them. If you donâ€™t have access to the keys because you lost access to your wallet, then you canâ€™t control your coins.

Another thing people will say is, â€œI have some bitcoin in my walletâ€. This is simply not true. This is an anachronistic understanding of what crypto wallets do. Even when people say they â€œownâ€ cryptocurrency, this isnâ€™t exactly the case. What they own, or what they are in possession of, is the Private key that allows them to control the coins associated with a particular Public key. This control plays out on the blockchain record where the software contained in a wallet allows the person to create a new record that shows the cryptocurrency is now assigned to a different Public key, which represents the address or identity of a different person. This new person will be the new owner, so long as they have their Private key.

## End Note

Since the last article I published, cryptocurrency prices have tanked. Some people are crying because they lost a bunch of money. Other people are patting themselves on the back for being so shrewd and knowing better than to invest in something as silly as computer money.

No one should be surprised. It was a bubble and the bubble popped. Many people have been forecasting a so-called Crypto Winter for awhile. Is this it? Maybe. Could things go lower? Maybe.

This isnâ€™t all bad. (Easy for me to say, I didnâ€™t just lose my shirt.) This will be a chance for web3 applications that are actually good, useful, and solve problems to rise to the top, while less valuable ideas and scams will get left behind. Projects that are inherently valuable will hang around and get better.

Iâ€™ll keep writing; you keep reading. If and when you decide to join the web3 world, it wonâ€™t be because of hype, but rather because you understand what you are getting into and you see the real value in it.

body:
This is `Season 02` of a 9+ season long music project. Read about the journey in our initial mirror article [Crisis (The Album)](https://kaf.mirror.xyz/dTjrd4JQ6RwsFaz7xKX5TyOQjKvsOZajF3rA7brqDuI) or on [crisisthealbum.xyz.](https://crisisthealbum.xyz)

## Season 02: The Raw Album

~~S-00 Crisis (The Worthless Album)~~ 
 ~~S-01 Crisis (The Valuable Album)~~

[edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0](edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0)

At the beginning of creating something, there is a fragile and delicate idea that no one, not even the creator, can say where it'll lead them. So having this moment captured in time and the possibility of returning to it is of great value to the creator.

> "Releasing the demos for *Crisis (The Album)* means providing insight into a stage of the process where I didn't even think if these songs would ever see the light of day. It's the raw first steps that these songs took. First sketches where I felt in small nuances that something was moving. Releasing these demos now is scary. Because they have to prove themselves without the protection of days of further thinking, producing, mixing and mastering that came on top of those sketches. So be kind to them."

â€” Valentin Hansen

![At Suol Studios in Berlin 2021](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/98WwAQbpF53kkMB9Ohw69.png?height=2080&width=3058)

Edition will remain available until all NFTs have been collected

As all Season 02's NFTs are collected, the album will enter its next stage and be shown in its primal and raw state. From then on, itâ€™ll be *Crisis (The Raw Album)* and will be released on DSPs in its draft form.

## Introduction

In its most basic form,Â *Crisis*Â is the debut album of Valentin Hansen, co-produced and released by Killing A Friend. In a broader sense,Â *Crisis*Â is an ongoing multi-media, multi-level experiment that explores alternative ideas for the distribution and exploitation of musical works. It is the journey of an album that defied the dominant structures of its system in order to break new ground.

This project aims to align *releases* â†”ï¸ *value* â†”ï¸ *community* into one common narrative. Read more about the processÂ below.

## Season 00 â€“ The Story

One year ago the journey of Crisis began with the release of *[Crisis (The Worthless Album)](https://open.spotify.com/album/7nwbv2tj8q9OTWhin3ZBsm).* What had been planned as a traditional release, changed due to a pivotal decision.

The album was cut into 30 pieces, each 29 seconds long. Since a stream only starts counting after 30 seconds of playtime, it can't collect plays or earn any revenue, no matter how much it's listened to. The value of this album is 0.000$

Ultimately, this is the only way to choose one's own value in the current system of being patronised by a pro-rata system (streaming) of big tech and major labels. By releasing an album this way, it reveals quite the imbalance and absurdity of the music industry's current monetisation model and asks if centralised platforms should define the value of art according to a demand-supply calculation. Or, instead, shall creators regain complete control over the value they create.

> "*Valentin Hansen released an album in a way thatâ€™s never been done before. In doing so, he highlighted the unprecedented shift in how music is being made as a direct result of the rule.*"
> â€” Brian Harrington, [The Album That's Worth Nothing](https://deathbyalgorithm.substack.com/p/the-album-thats-worth-nothing)

No matter how many of the industry tricks we utilised, we ended up in a zero-sum game.

![An exhibition with a click farm. Multiple phones were streaming the album day and night. Stream count: 0](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yDX5NZ9QkjYJJXEbu4-0q.png?height=1490&width=3070)

![Vinyl records were being sold in 14 cities worldwide. Retail price: 0.00 $ â‚¬ Â£ â‚½ â‚©](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rIQn5Iqm0bbR5OW3Wy_OU.png?height=1984&width=3062)

![Spotifyâ€™s 2021 wrapped looked as expected: 0 Streams, 0 Listeners, 0 Hours, 0 Countries](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kKPpqY4bmsyioxNArLKFr.png?height=1024&width=1024)

## Process

*Crisis (The Album)*Â will now embark on a multi-level journey to be transformed and have its monetary and cultural worth evaluated by the community. To put it more simply, we will distribute ownership ofÂ *Crisis*Â during 9+ seasons.

Therefore, the original album was minted as one piece of music onÂ [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/valentinhansen/crisis-the-album-).

Ownership of this NFT will be represented by each season's tokens (editions of NFTs), with 50% of the shares being transferred within the first nine seasons. Additionally, each season represents the album in its current form. As seasonal NFTs are collected, the album starts to change visually, sonically, & experientially until that particular season sells out.

Upon sellout, a new season unlocks, shape- shifting the album once more and unlocking further experiences, products, visuals, etc.

The remaining 50% will be allocated in season 10. This wayâ€”when the album becomes the most expensive work of music ever soldâ€”it'll be fully owned by the community that helped it reach this status.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iIhgeVic-qPXG15O8qcM5.jpg?height=2589&width=2767)

The journey will continue as long as people keep unlocking the next chapter. Season NFTs will be sold in the form of editions onÂ Mirror.

This is `Season 02` of a 9+ season long music project. Read about the journey in our initial mirror article [Crisis (The Album)](https://kaf.mirror.xyz/dTjrd4JQ6RwsFaz7xKX5TyOQjKvsOZajF3rA7brqDuI) or on [crisisthealbum.xyz.](https://crisisthealbum.xyz)

## Season 02: The Raw Album

~~S-00 Crisis (The Worthless Album)~~ 
 ~~S-01 Crisis (The Valuable Album)~~

[edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0](edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0)

At the beginning of creating something, there is a fragile and delicate idea that no one, not even the creator, can say where it'll lead them. So having this moment captured in time and the possibility of returning to it is of great value to the creator.

> "Releasing the demos for *Crisis (The Album)* means providing insight into a stage of the process where I didn't even think if these songs would ever see the light of day. It's the raw first steps that these songs took. First sketches where I felt in small nuances that something was moving. Releasing these demos now is scary. Because they have to prove themselves without the protection of days of further thinking, producing, mixing and mastering that came on top of those sketches. So be kind to them."

â€” Valentin Hansen

![At Suol Studios in Berlin 2021](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/98WwAQbpF53kkMB9Ohw69.png?height=2080&width=3058)

Edition will remain available until all NFTs have been collected

As all Season 02's NFTs are collected, the album will enter its next stage and be shown in its primal and raw state. From then on, itâ€™ll be *Crisis (The Raw Album)* and will be released on DSPs in its draft form.

title: What is Ingang
body:
### https://Ingang.xyz

(Published on 19/6/2022)

Contact : ingang.web3@gmail.com

## What is Ingang

Ingang is currently developed as Twitter, but totally with wallet login, you donâ€™t need to register an account, but the way to login is also limited, you must have Metamask extension in your browser, and currently not support login with mobile version.

You can publish what you want to say, and like messages. The following user and comment system is under developing.

## How it works

Metamask browser version support others sending a message that can only be decrypted by the address owner, so Ingang send an encrypted message to you, this message include a key that both sides can use it to encrypt and decrypt, every time user login, this key will renew, so this can make sure that the message received and send is only for the address owner. To send message that can only be decrypted by address owner, I need to get your EncryptionPublicKey use this function , so as your first time login, it will ask you to provide the encryption public key, this is not even your public key of you ETH account.

The Ingang does not track you any data, all information comes from your Metamask address, you donâ€™t need to worry about traditional privacy problems.

The current goal of Ingang, to encourage good content producers come to publish valuable information. Every month income from the advertisement will **directly send ETH** to the top producers, the proportion and distribution is still under consideration, but now I think it should be more than 50% of profit every year.

Also after Ingang grown up ( I hope it could be : ), it can run as Substack or some other profitable business to support it running.

## Roadmap

Currently, user following function is under development. It should be release soon.

Next step will be upload content to system like Arweave or IPFS, I am still learning how it works and how to implement this.  Since upload content to this kind of system is expensive, which content to be uploaded will be selected by rule, not by people, for example, if user address is new or asset is under 100 USD, itâ€™s content can only send to IPFS 1Mb every week, unless it become top generator once. But all this is still under consideration. This is just a framework I am thinking about, this is a trade off between open security and cost.

After this, it should be to do some job as address analysis, the main page content will recommend depends on the user address, this will be a big job.

### (Updated on 26/6/2022)

Following system is somehow working now, next is redesign the UI

### (Updated on 12/7/2022)

New UI deployed, next step is add function of nickname.

title: CRISIS-02: The Raw Album
body:
This is `Season 02` of a 9+ season long music album project. Read about the journey in our initial mirror article [Crisis (The Album)](https://kaf.mirror.xyz/dTjrd4JQ6RwsFaz7xKX5TyOQjKvsOZajF3rA7brqDuI) or on [crisisthealbum.xyz.](https://crisisthealbum.xyz)

## Season 02: The Raw Album

~~S-00 Crisis (The Worthless Album)~~
~~S-01 Crisis (The Valuable Album)~~

[edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0](edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0)

At the beginning of creating something, there is a fragile and delicate idea that no one, not even the creator, can say where it'll lead them. So having this moment captured in time and the possibility of returning to it is of great value to the creator.

> "Releasing the demos for *Crisis (The Album)* means providing insight into a stage of the process where I didn't even think if these songs would ever see the light of day. It's the raw first steps that these songs took. First sketches where I felt in small nuances that something was moving. Releasing these demos now is scary. Because they have to prove themselves without the protection of days of further thinking, producing, mixing and mastering that came on top of those sketches. So be kind to them."

â€” Valentin Hansen

![At Suol Studios in Berlin 2021](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/98WwAQbpF53kkMB9Ohw69.png?height=2080&width=3058)

Edition will remain available until all NFTs have been collected

As all Season 02's NFTs are collected, the album will enter its next stage and be shown in its primal and raw state. From then on, itâ€™ll be *Crisis (The Raw Album)* and will be released on DSPs in its draft form.

title: What is Ingang
body:
### https://Ingang.xyz

(Published on 19/6/2022)

Contact : ingang.web3@gmail.com

## What is Ingang

Ingang is currently developed as Twitter, but totally with wallet login, you donâ€™t need to register an account, but the way to login is also limited, you must have Metamask extension in your browser, and currently not support login with mobile version.

You can publish what you want to say, and like messages. The following user and comment system is under developing.

## How it works

Metamask browser version support others sending a message that can only be decrypted by the address owner, so Ingang send an encrypted message to you, this message include a key that both sides can use it to encrypt and decrypt, every time user login, this key will renew, so this can make sure that the message received and send is only for the address owner. To send message that can only be decrypted by address owner, I need to get your EncryptionPublicKey use this function , so as your first time login, it will ask you to provide the encryption public key, this is not even your public key of you ETH account.

The Ingang does not track you any data, all information comes from your Metamask address, you donâ€™t need to worry about traditional privacy problems.

The current goal of Ingang, to encourage good content producers come to publish valuable information. Every month income from the advertisement will **directly send ETH** to the top producers, the proportion and distribution is still under consideration, but now I think it should be more than 50% of profit every year.

Also after Ingang grown up ( I hope it could be : ), it can run as Substack or some other profitable business to support it running.

## Roadmap

Currently, user following function is under development. It should be release soon.

Next step will be upload content to system like Arweave or IPFS, I am still learning how it works and how to implement this.  Since upload content to this kind of system is expensive, which content to be uploaded will be selected by rule, not by people, for example, if user address is new or asset is under 100 USD, itâ€™s content can only send to IPFS 1Mb every week, unless it become top generator once. But all this is still under consideration. This is just a framework I am thinking about, this is a trade off between open security and cost.

After this, it should be to do some job as address analysis, the main page content will recommend depends on the user address, this will be a big job.

### (Updated on 26/6/2022)

Following system is somehow working now, next is redesign the UI

### (Updated on 12/7/2022)

New UI deployed, next step is add function of nickname.

title: CRISIS-02: The Raw Album
body:
This is `Season 02` of a 9+ season long music album project. Read about the journey in our initial mirror article [Crisis (The Album)](https://kaf.mirror.xyz/dTjrd4JQ6RwsFaz7xKX5TyOQjKvsOZajF3rA7brqDuI) or on [crisisthealbum.xyz.](https://crisisthealbum.xyz)

~~S-00 Crisis (The Worthless Album)~~
~~S-01 Crisis (The Valuable Album)~~

[edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0](edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0)

At the beginning of creating something, there is a fragile and delicate idea that no one, not even the creator, can say where it'll lead them. So having this moment captured in time and the possibility of returning to it is of great value to the creator.

> "Releasing the demos for *Crisis (The Album)* means providing insight into a stage of the process where I didn't even think if these songs would ever see the light of day. It's the raw first steps that these songs took. First sketches where I felt in small nuances that something was moving. Releasing these demos now is scary. Because they have to prove themselves without the protection of days of further thinking, producing, mixing and mastering that came on top of those sketches. So be kind to them."

â€” Valentin Hansen

![At Suol Studios in Berlin 2021](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/98WwAQbpF53kkMB9Ohw69.png?height=2080&width=3058)

Edition will remain available until all NFTs have been collected

As all Season 02's NFTs are collected, the album will enter its next stage and be shown in its primal and raw state. From then on, itâ€™ll be *Crisis (The Raw Album)* and will be released on DSPs in its draft form.

title: A dedicated subgraph for Europa Applications
body:
***Europa is excited to announce a performance upgrade for our core service â€“ driven by native integration with a dedicated subgraph.***

The Graph is the indexing and query layer of web3. Anyone can build and publish open APIs, called subgraphs, making data easily accessible.

The integration of a dedicated subgraph into our service enables the Europa Web3 App Engine to index smart contract data for faster queries for our customer applications.

For Europa applications, like [11 Captainsâ€™ Club,](https://members.11captainsclub.io/my-tokens) this means an automatic update which migrates Europa Applications to its own dedicated subgraph, enabling applications to use a GraphQL interface for lightning-fast lookups.

Rather than using a third-party data service to pull NFT metadata (like OpenSea API, etc.), Europa has built its own metadata rendering service, which indexes key collection content and events natively with a [dedicated subgraph](https://thegraph.com/docs/en/developer/define-subgraph-hosted/).

This subgraph is associated and mapped to the Europa Ethereum Contracts.Â  The subgraph has been published to The Graphâ€™s decentralized network, which makes it available for Curators to begin curating on it, and Indexers to begin indexing it.

## Europa Indexers

Indexers are node operators in The Graph Network that stake Graph Tokens (GRT) in order to provide indexing and query processing services. Indexers earn query fees and indexing rewards for their services.

Indexers select subgraphs to index based on the subgraphâ€™s curation signal, where Curators stake GRT in order to indicate which subgraphs are high-quality and should be prioritized. Consumers (eg. applications) can also set parameters for which Indexers process queries for their subgraphs and set preferences for query fee pricing.

Already, we have 10 individual indexers ensuring high availability for Europa-related indexed contract data, and expect many more:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FJqBSyQXC1_ciZ3P2nm17.png?height=1666&width=2880)

We are very excited to use with The Graph to create performant, optimized, and web3 native applications for our customers.Â  Europa is dedicated to building web3 loyalty applications, at scale, using

Europa is a web3 application engine.Â  Data is stored and accessed via a decentralized infrastructure that leverages core protocols like The Graph, Storj, and Pocket RPC to ensure a robust, secure data layer for our web3 applications.

This is accomplished without relying on centralized cloud infrastructure or risking downtime for data accessibility.

Europa Labs provides a full-suite Web3 product engine for brands interested in adopting blockchain technology. The platform offers support for NFTs, digital asset payments, digital tokens for physical redeemables, and more.


---

## About Europa Labs

The crypto-native team at Europa Labs integrates with protocols such as Ethereum, OpenSea, The Graph, and zkSync to offer composable, cutting edge solutions for their clients. The solution scales along with the customerâ€™s business. Through Europaâ€™s solution, customers can easily mint tokenized redeemables, offer them to their communities, and deliver the digital assets to customers. This allows customers to focus on their business, rather than the underlying Web3 technology.

Europa is a proven SaaS solution built by experienced crypto engineers â€“ that makes it simple for brands to enter web3, and tap into the customer engagement, creator monetization, and tokenized incentive structures that makes web3 so appealing to consumers and brands.

E-Commerce is already a dominant, 5.5T dollar industry, and the web3 stack has the potential to disrupt it entirely.

Tokenization of physical goods can transform this entire market, just like decentralized finance has disrupted traditional finance, and NFTs have disrupted the traditional art market.Â  We are building a solution to service this niche at scale.

For more information about web3 loyalty platforms, visit [europalabs.io](https://europalabs.io)

## About The Graph

[The Graph](https://thegraph.com/) is the indexing and query layer of web3. Developers build and publish open APIs, called subgraphs, that applications can query using GraphQL. The Graph currently supports indexing data from over 35 different networks including Ethereum, NEAR, Arbitrum, Optimism, Polygon, Avalanche, Celo, Fantom, Moonbeam, IPFS, and PoA with more networks coming soon. To date, over 63[,700+ subgraphs](https://thegraph.com/explorer/) have been deployed on the hosted service, with 445 deployed on the decentralized network. Tens of thousands of developers use The Graph for applications such as Uniswap, Synthetix, KnownOrigin, Art Blocks, Gnosis, Balancer, Livepeer, DAOstack, Audius, Decentraland, and many others.

title: Visit to the Mall
body:
A boy and his father visiting from a third world country were at Lakeside Mall. They were amazed by almost everything they sawï¼Œbut especially by two shinyï¼Œsilver walls that could move apart and back together again.

The boy asked his fatherï¼Œâ€œWhat is thisï¼ŒFatherï¼Ÿâ€The father respondedï¼Œâ€œSonï¼ŒI have never seen anything like this in my life. I donâ€™t know what it isï¼â€

While the boy and his father were watching widely-eyedï¼Œan old lady in a wheel chair rolled up to the moving walls and pressed a button. The walls opened and the lady rolled between them into a small room. The walls closed and the boy and his father watched small circles of numbers above the walls light up. They continued to watch the circles light up in the reverse direction. The walls opened up again and a voluptuous 24-year-old woman stepped out.

title: How to create your own Smart Contract using Manifold
body:
In this post, I will try my best to tell you how you can create your own contract using [@manifoldxyz](https://twitter.com/manifoldxyz). I will be using screenshots on every step, and the wording should be easily translated into any language.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Mi_Sg1SCstvrNKqa0DDwf.png?height=432&width=680)

Connect your wallet using [@MetaMask](https://twitter.com/MetaMask) and fill out the form welcoming you with the necessary information. Only the name section is required, the others are optional. Click Submit.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/b96GbnhZ83wSioV29mdUf.png?height=454&width=680)

Click on ğ—¡ğ—²ğ˜„ ğ—–ğ—¼ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—°ğ˜ button. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CxMpfvzUhF3dQ4CP_Fyzb.png?height=454&width=680)

ğ—–ğ—¼ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—°ğ˜ ğ—¡ğ—®ğ—ºğ—² will be the name of the collection on [@opensea](https://twitter.com/opensea) or [@foundation](https://twitter.com/foundation). Choose wisely, as you will not be able to change the name later on.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Z3H9dPWkVuPI2kONonYgu.png?height=513&width=680)

Contract ğ—§ğ˜†ğ—½ğ—² depends on your collection. If you are thinking about minting 1/1 works, then your best option will be ERC721. If you will be minting different editions of the same work, then you must choose ERC1155. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FhXOu6pUElYaE95GaRKHj.png?height=513&width=680)

Exhibit A: An artist creating an ERC721 contract and minting 3 editions of the same work. All editions will be listed separately. Exhibit B: An artist mints 20K editions of the same work using the ERC1155 contract. All editions are listed under the same artwork.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E21pzEToekIfhObWn4I9-.png?height=446&width=851)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c2XBMy8xhw9WSM-jXhiNQ.png?height=417&width=837)

The Symbol of the contract may be the shortened version of your contract name. This is the short name of the token and will be visible on [@etherscan](https://twitter.com/etherscan) as a token symbol.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XGdUvZKOlEzlYVArP19S1.png?height=513&width=680)

ASCII Mark section is for you to create a unique artwork for your contract. This is visible on [@etherscan](https://twitter.com/etherscan) as Contract information. You can search for "text to ascii" or "image to ascii" to find plenty of tools. Copy the text and paste it here to test how it looks. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3jTD01q0T-WNbZd_ZcA7F.png?height=519&width=680)

After everything looks right, click on Deploy to Rinkeby. Rinkeby is a test network for Ethereum. Before you mint anything on the Mainnet, you can do your test here.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0cECpNPhlie7SCQm2DtHW.png?height=509&width=679)

Click on Switch Network here to change your Metamask to the Rinkeby Test Network. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vOsjCBMcEgXKTRu4oO3nZ.png?height=509&width=680)

You need to have Rinkeby Test ETH in your wallet to make transactions on the test network. Go to one of these linked sites and request test ETH to be sent to your wallet. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WW7EyZWI2xshkbseliGjI.png?height=509&width=680)

Add your wallet address here and click on "Send me ETH". The test ETH will be sent to you shortly. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-qOTOzDJnAnPxDTXNib6S.png?height=509&width=680)

 
 Click on "Deploy to Rinkeby" button again, Click "Confirm" when the transaction appears. Wait for the transaction to complete. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NRcrLaarxsCMjbc-gC3T7.png?height=513&width=680)

Your contract is deployed on Rinkeby Test Network. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fTWtBIAEfbwDmRqQlK9T0.png?height=518&width=680)

Click on "Go to Dashboard" This is the place where your contract lives. You can now Deploy the contract on the Mainnet, or test mint an artwork on the test network. Click on "Mint a Token on Rinkeby" to test mint. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jEn95RIZtsVLtKEtzHGPE.png?height=518&width=680)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CdDYGsH6jo3Evc4O2ZhCH.png?height=518&width=680)

This is the place for you to mint a new artwork. a. Add your artwork here. b. Name of your artwork. c. Description of your artwork. d. Attributes After you're finished, click on "Mint to Rinkeby". 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kKJffpxDIrx5zubR8ugEi.png?height=483&width=679)

If you are uploading a photograph, Manifold will automatically see the EXIF information. You can choose to include some of this information as attributes. If it's a Digital Illustration or computer-generated image, this won't pop up! 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oz46b8pFoVqLeCMTvVS4i.png?height=483&width=679)

All chosen options will be listed under the artwork as Attributes. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/k9aPRiRRGCNbnOGIiPWtt.png?height=483&width=679)

Choose "Myself"  
 Click on Mint.  
 Confirm the transaction.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/DjCxjMIew7KWnX72lWcRf.png?height=483&width=679)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/M0m2Ue0wDRAJxsbaQE_Qw.png?height=782&width=1100)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6K21VPqnGbW15OsXRgpkR.png?height=782&width=1100)

You can see your minted artwork on different platforms from the links here. Remember, this artwork is only minted on Rinkeby Test Network. When everything looks good, go ahead with the next step. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/R_8m6jjRApZgztUnSNpC1.png?height=839&width=1079)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/j7lqdGgM2jTI8rMjPbkmE.png?height=855&width=1109)

Go back to the dashboard and deploy the contract to the mainnet. Before you do any transaction on mainnet, check the gas information from the section above. If it looks good, go ahead deploying your contract. The steps are the same with deploying to the Rinkeby. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/adJVwinO7gVmCJOUFRfsp.png?height=861&width=1161)

Here is an example of a Contract I minted on Mainnet. In the third and fourth image, you can see the token I minted and listed on Foundation.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tihC2Tc05UP1FPloBXFZp.png?height=727&width=1131)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ulg9Jf0dRxYSdNlY6SmdT.png?height=763&width=880)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nF4S0ogdUxUlEZVbiXi9e.png?height=763&width=881)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pGbpX3SI8CcMiLrplwhn3.png?height=826&width=1001)

If you have any more questions or need more information while you're creating your contract, feel free to DM me. If there is more information to be added to this thread, I will include them later on. 

An update comes from [@ylzkrtt](https://twitter.com/ylzkrtt) : You can update the metadata on a minted artwork on Manifold. However the changes will not be visible on [@foundation](https://twitter.com/foundation), but you can update it on [@opensea](https://twitter.com/opensea) using Refresh Metadata button.

title: Web3 startups
body:
These are some applications, startups and protocols that have the most potential and that are closely aligned with web3's mission of decentralization and distribution of value.

**Mirror**: You could say that Mirror is the web3 alternative to Medium. A web3 protocol oriented to blogging. In the case of Medium, it is not so much the percentage that remains of the creators, so I am not going to bar them as much, but even so, it owns all the content, controls the exposure algorithms, and does not let the creators monetize themselves from other ways. It explicitly prohibits any link and is free to block anyone who does not follow "its policies", as it did in 2018.

Mirror proposes a native web3 alternative where creators can monetize in various ways they can think of. It allows, for example, to create NFT of the articles so that they can sell them or do a crowd-founding prior to writing so that fans can finance content. Also, the content is ours, not mirror's, and they use decentralized servers like Arweave (which I'll talk about later) so that the information is eternal.

**Lens Protocol**: This project is focused on identity, data portability and the social. They created the social layer 0 that allows developers to invent applications that run on this blockchain/protocol and that, for example, we can switch between applications while maintaining full control of our preferences, privacy, and our connections (friends). The next Twitter, Instagram or Facebook will be built on Lens, but unlike current business models, they will not be able to exploit our information for advertising or invent vicious algorithms to keep us looking at the screen.

I talk more about Lens in my other note on identity.

**BAT**: Basic Attention Token is an initiative of the Brave browser that was invented by Brendan Eich who is none other than the inventor of JavaScript, Mozilla and Firefox. Brave is a browser that blocks all third-party cookies (Google Ads, etc.) that spy on our behavior in order to offer us invasive advertising. By blocking all tracheas we become invisible to corporations that want to exploit our information, and on top of that browsing is faster because you don't have to load all the JavaScript for these cookies.

But in order not to leave advertisers out, Brave offers incentives in the BAT token for those who wish to receive advertising voluntarily, let's say. So you browse, you are aware that you are giving information to advertisers and in exchange for that, you receive advertising. A win-win, or at least a fairer, logical and less extractive way. At least we get something.

**OpenSea**: OpenSea is the leading marketplace for NFT exchanges. It is the easiest to understand what it is for because it is as if it were an Amazon or MercadoLibre, something that already exists, but unlike web2 marketplaces, OpenSea publishes the content of our wallets, it does not own our information. We can choose to publish them on OpenSea or quickly go to a competitor. It is as if we had an NFT of our MercadoLibre publications and we could change the platform whenever we wanted.

Given the portability of the data, OpenSea is open source, since it does not gain anything by not being open source, on the contrary, it is a competitive advantage to be open source in crypto rather than not. If you are open source and open, others can join you, allowing you to maintain your leadership position. OpenSea charges 2.5% also because it is what the market allows, otherwise a competitor that charges less can easily appear.

**Arweave**: It is a network similar to IPFS+Filecoin, but under this system eternal storage is guaranteed. Due to the logic of this blockchain, the miners who receive the $AR (Arweave) token must be able to demonstrate access to random content/file at all times in order to validate new transactions. This forces the miners to continue to keep copies of the old files because otherwise they cannot continue mining.

I talk more about decentralized storage in this note

**ENS**: Ethereum Name Service is like a router from blockchain addresses (wallets) to names in text format, with .eth at the end. The project lets you register a domain, like a .com, but an .eth, and assign the wallet to which it corresponds. More similar to how an alias works, but this alias is yours and you can assign the wallet you need to it.

ENS is also an open-source protocol and is run entirely by the ENS DAO where every change or improvement is voted on. The domains have an annual cost, but they do this so that no one abuses the system and that those who use it have the opportunity to use them. Also everything generated is donated to charity, so ENS is a non-profit organization.

## Introduction

In its most basic form,Â *Crisis*Â is the debut album of Valentin Hansen, co-produced and released by Killing A Friend. In a broader sense,Â *Crisis*Â is an ongoing multi-media, multi-level experiment that explores alternative ideas for the distribution and exploitation of musical works. It is the journey of an album that defied the dominant structures of its system in order to break new ground.

This project aims to align *releases* â†”ï¸ *value* â†”ï¸ *community* into one common narrative. Read more about the processÂ below.

## Season 00 â€“ The Story

One year ago the journey of Crisis began with the release of *[Crisis (The Worthless Album)](https://open.spotify.com/album/7nwbv2tj8q9OTWhin3ZBsm).* What had been planned as a traditional release, changed due to a pivotal decision.

The album was cut into 30 pieces, each 29 seconds long. Since a stream only starts counting after 30 seconds of playtime, it can't collect plays or earn any revenue, no matter how much it's listened to. The value of this album is 0.000$

Ultimately, this is the only way to choose one's own value in the current system of being patronised by a pro-rata system (streaming) of big tech and major labels. By releasing an album this way, it reveals quite the imbalance and absurdity of the music industry's current monetisation model and asks if centralised platforms should define the value of art according to a demand-supply calculation. Or, instead, shall creators regain complete control over the value they create.

> "*Valentin Hansen released an album in a way thatâ€™s never been done before. In doing so, he highlighted the unprecedented shift in how music is being made as a direct result of the rule.*"
> â€” Brian Harrington, [The Album That's Worth Nothing](https://deathbyalgorithm.substack.com/p/the-album-thats-worth-nothing)

No matter how many of the industry tricks we utilised, we ended up in a zero-sum game.

![An exhibition with a click farm. Multiple phones were streaming the album day and night. Stream count: 0](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yDX5NZ9QkjYJJXEbu4-0q.png?height=1490&width=3070)

![Vinyl records were being sold in 14 cities worldwide. Retail price: 0.00 $ â‚¬ Â£ â‚½ â‚©](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rIQn5Iqm0bbR5OW3Wy_OU.png?height=1984&width=3062)

![Spotifyâ€™s 2021 wrapped looked as expected: 0 Streams, 0 Listeners, 0 Hours, 0 Countries](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kKPpqY4bmsyioxNArLKFr.png?height=1024&width=1024)

## Process

*Crisis (The Album)*Â will now embark on a multi-level journey to be transformed and have its monetary and cultural worth evaluated by the community. To put it more simply, we will distribute ownership ofÂ *Crisis*Â during 9+ seasons.

Therefore, the original album was minted as one piece of music onÂ [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/valentinhansen/crisis-the-album-).

Ownership of this NFT will be represented by each season's tokens (editions of NFTs), with 50% of the shares being transferred within the first nine seasons. Additionally, each season represents the album in its current form. As seasonal NFTs are collected, the album starts to change visually, sonically, & experientially until that particular season sells out.

Upon sellout, a new season unlocks, shape- shifting the album once more and unlocking further experiences, products, visuals, etc.

The remaining 50% will be allocated in season 10. This wayâ€”when the album becomes the most expensive work of music ever soldâ€”it'll be fully owned by the community that helped it reach this status.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iIhgeVic-qPXG15O8qcM5.jpg?height=2589&width=2767)

The journey will continue as long as people keep unlocking the next chapter. Season NFTs will be sold in the form of editions onÂ Mirror.

## Seasons

The journey will be split into 9+1 defined seasons as listed below:

title: Vellir #1 â†’ The Vellir View
body:
We believe that blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies are the foundation for the next paradigm of the internet.

* **Web1 = read only** â†’ browsers allowed users to surf the web and access information more easily.
* **Web2 = read and write** â†’ interactive applications allowed users to connect, create content and communicate, while mobile enabled this to happen from anywhere.
* **Web3** **= read, write, own** â†’ blockchain technology means that users will own their own data, aligning value creation and capture, and creating a new social contract.

Web3 has powerful intrinsic network effects â€“ composable/interoperable infrastructure and tokenisation that aligns incentives and supports community building. This will drive the creation of new applications that promote ownership, participation and community. We believe that the ownership economy will transform the internet, and with it our digital and physical lives.

But this web3 future still needs to be built and shaped. So we started Project Vellir.

Project Vellirâ€™s mission is to improve understanding of web3/crypto technology; build web3 solutions, including to problems related to governance, coordination, ownership, participation and community; and support companies and governments with the rapid transition to web3.

**We do this by combining public insight, an advisory practice and in house studio, a thoughtful community and web3 native investment platform.**

Our thesis is based on three overlapping themes.

1. **Democratic processes and institutions:** The Vellir Project takes inspiration from Ãingvellir (the "Assembly Fields") in Iceland, site of the longest running Parliament in the world. In the early 10th century, it was a meeting place for clans to hold discussions and legal sessions, and subsequently became the site of the Icelandic Parliament, now in Reykjavik. The site was chosen because it was accessible for all clans for their annual parliament. And while we still have the same fundamental participation, community decision-making and governance needs to address, there are no longer the same constraints on geography, physical representation and time between consulting citizens. We believe that web3 tools have the potential to be the Ãingvellirs of the future â€“ creating new accessible gathering places, and transforming how participatory systems, governance and policy processes, models and institutions work.
2. **Financial inclusion:** Financial inclusion means more than just having access to a bank account. It means having a meaningful stake in society and the capital economy. This requires ownership of data and assets, and means that close creating value with the insights from their data also gain some of the upside. The rise of the sovereign individual has the potential to radically change financial inclusion through DeFi, community ownership and social tokens. We believe that this broader democratisation has the potential to create universal basic equity, which could be an important feature of a more equal and fair social and economic structure.
3. **Protecting and rewarding data, privacy and security:** A core part of a positive internet future is one where data is owned and encrypted; privacy is the default and built in; and infrastructure is secure. The web3 stack is evolving quickly, but we believe it must have these features embedded from the outset in order to be sustainable and meet the needs of consumers.

Subscribe to get our latest insights at www.vellir.xyz - and come and start your web3 journey with us!

Tenemos mil cuentas y mil contraseÃ±as. En verdad, para ser mÃ¡s exactos, la media son mÃ¡s de 100 contraseÃ±as por persona. Â¡Eso es una locura! SÃ­, hay gente que no pone la misma en todos los sitios, espero que tÃº no seas de esos. Por cada aplicaciÃ³n o web que accedemos, tenemos que **registrarnos** y **crear** una **cuenta nueva**.

Apple Id es una de las soluciones a eso, te conectas con la misma cuenta en todos lados. Pero se queda ahÃ­, es limitado por apple, por quien lo quiera integrar, te fÃ­as de su seguridad y **no te aporta nada mÃ¡s**.

Pero, Â¿cÃ³mo podrÃ­amos **eliminar la necesidad de una contraseÃ±a**?, cÃ³mo podrÃ­amos acceder ha contenido, tener acceso exclusivo, formar parte de una comunidad solo para aquellos que tengan la misma cuenta?, si **modificamos** **cuenta** por **token**, es posible.

AsÃ­ saliÃ³ la idea de token gating, **eliminar** la necesidad de un **nombre de usuario** y una **contraseÃ±a**, y **conectarte** con tu **wallet**. Hemos pasado de usar el correo a tener tokens que nos dan **acceso** a diferente **contenido**.

Nos gusta formar parte de comunidades, nos gusta tener algo especial y Ãºnico para nosotros. Coleccionamos cromos desde pequeÃ±os y nos gusta juntarnos con gente con la misma **visiÃ³n, gustos y/o interÃ©s**.

Esa es la **experiencia** que se genera con un **token**, nos da un **prestigio**, un **estatus** social y ademÃ¡s de todo eso, tiene **escasez**, la **experiencia** de tener algo **exclusivo** solo para unos cuantos.

En este artÃ­culo explicarÃ© como naciÃ³ token gating y como de dar acceso a una pÃ¡gina web, se ha convertido en un **estÃ¡ndar en el ecosistema**.

### Utilidad del token

En todos los social tokens o monedas de comunidad, hay tres caracterÃ­sticos importantes:

* **Utilidad**: que le ofreces a tu comunidad si compran tu token
* **DistribuciÃ³n**: a quien distribuyes tu token
* **Liquidez**: tener un mercado secundario donde nuevos miembros puedan comprar y entrar en la comunidad

A dÃ­a de hoy, tenemos 20.258 monedas en el mercado. Pero, Â¿**cuÃ¡ntos de ellos los utilizas a diario**? Â¿Cuantos te dan un privilegio? Â¿**Cuantos te dan acceso**? Â¿Cuantos te permiten **hacer algo mÃ¡s** que solo **tenerlos en tu wallet**? Esto que parece obvio ahora, hace unos aÃ±os no se percibÃ­a de la misma manera. El foco estaba en DeFi, estaba en proporcionar **liquidez** y poco a poco en **distribuirlo** a miembros especÃ­ficos, los famosos airdrops. Pero pocos se enfocaban en el next step, en **quÃ© hacer con el token**.

Desde [MintGate](https://twitter.com/mintgate_io) estudiamos cÃ³mo se comportaban los tokens y de quÃ© manera un artista, un creador de contenido o una marca los pueden utilizar.

La primera pregunta fue; Â¿quÃ© le gusta a un fan, que le hace sentir especial? La respuesta: **exclusividad**. Sentirse parte de una comunidad cercana, poder comunicarse con su creador de contenido favorito y tener privilegios por estar ahÃ­.

De ahÃ­ saliÃ³ **Token Gated Access**. Poner una barrera entre un contenido premium y tu comunidad. **Eliminando por completo la necesidad de acceder con una contraseÃ±a**.

[https://forefront.market/blog/guest-david-token-ownership](https://forefront.market/blog/guest-david-token-ownership)

### Pero, Â¿que es token gating?

La definiciÃ³n mÃ¡s simple es **restringir** el **acceso** a **contenido exclusivo** exigiendo a los miembros de una comunidad que **adquieran un NFT o nÃºmero de tokens especÃ­fico**.

El token actÃºa como **clave de acceso** que se verifica conectando la wallet.

Â¿CuÃ¡l es ese contenido que necesita "protecciÃ³n"? En realidad, cualquier contenido digital, desde un sitio web, contenidos exclusivos, chats privados en Discord hasta eventos virtuales en Decentraland.

Lo hemos visto en plataformas como [Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/), donde miembros pagan una suscripciÃ³n por acceder a contenido exclusivo. Â¿Pero, y si le **damos la vuelta** a eso y **pagas una entrada, una vez, y accedes para siempre**? Las principales caracterÃ­sticas de token gating son:

* **Acceso**: tanto ha contenido como un grupo de chat
* **Seguridad**: no se puede acceder con una pestaÃ±a en oculto o compartir externamente. Solo aquellos que tengan los tokens pueden visualizar.
* **Utilidad**: el token es solo la puerta de entrada, puedes monetizar o dar perks en una comunidad

Token gating permite a las comunidades beneficiarse del control de quiÃ©n tiene acceso a sus contenidos. Puedes **crear diferentes rangos** y dar **beneficios** a aquellos que **contribuyen**.

El acceso con token es una forma de **mejorar la seguridad**. Solo se puede acceder a los datos almacenados mediante token gating una vez que el usuario ha demostrado su **identidad**. Por lo tanto, token gating es una puerta perfecta para crear **sistemas de verificaciÃ³n de varios niveles**. Pasamos de solo acceder a contenido a proteger pÃ¡ginas webs. Un [A/B test](https://vwo.com/es/ab-testing/), donde aquellos que tengan 100 tokens ven algo diferente de aquellos que solo tengan un NFT.

Este nuevo mecanismo para **monetizar el contenido o el acceso** viene con varios beneficios para los creadores y los miembros, no solo alineando los incentivos, sino tambiÃ©n convirtiendo los servicios y productos en activos que puedes tener ownership sobre ello y venderlo. **Ya no es solo una contraseÃ±a, sino un activo digital.**

El token gating es una forma de **aÃ±adir mÃ¡s valor a un token**, permitiendo al titular el acceso exclusivo a una comunidad, contenido o incluso productos fÃ­sicos ademÃ¡s del token. **Una contraseÃ±a con beneficios**. 

### Casos de uso

Para [crear](https://medium.com/mintgate/announcing-token-protected-pages-23d917c37727) un **token gated access**, se necesitaban 3 pasos; el contenido que quieres proteger, con que token, y el mÃ­nimo requerido. Si era una colecciÃ³n de NFTs, podÃ­as hasta indicar unos ID especÃ­ficos (solo el BAYC 2121, 3131 y 4141).

Uno de los primeros casos de uso que tuvimos fue una [pÃ¡gina web](https://jnryfirst.com/firstaudio) con [$FIRST](https://twitter.com/harrisonfirst?s=20&t=Acv6zJNdotZ39aJpxuH23A) donde los miembros de la comunidad tenÃ­an acceso exclusivo a contenido de audio para usar en sus NFTs. De ahÃ­ empezamos a **tokenizar** **acceso** a una **playlist de Spotify, un artÃ­culo, videos o documentos en Google Drive para DAOs**. Desde que lanzamos nuestra plataforma, hemos tenido mas de **27.300 miembros** utilizando token gated links.

**La utilidad es abierta** al creador o a la comunidad, **no hay lÃ­mites**, cualquier contenido digital, se puede proteger y encriptar con un token, dando **seguridad a los miembros** y haciendo que el contenido sea **Ãºnicamente exclusivo para ellos**. Nosotros pusimos una herramienta sencilla, ellos crearon acceso a:

* Trabajo (**Calendly, Zoom, Google Drive, Dropbox**)
* IRL meet (**Formularios, RSVP, Tickets**)
* Video (**Youtube, Vimeo**)
* MÃºsica (**Spotify, SoundCloud, Audius**)
* Web (**Dominio propio, Shopify**)

![Experiencia token gated con los Golden State Warriors](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QsSTvq8joeQNyJspiHfLx.jpeg?height=694&width=1400)

En cuanto a comunidad, destacarÃ­a [FWB](https://www.fwb.help/). Es la **comunidad por referencia** en el ecosistema de social tokens. Hogar de muchas subculturas, FWB existe como un ecosistema de relaciones, un estudio creativo descentralizado y un grupo de chat interminable. Para leer su newsletter o acceder al discord necesitas tener una **cantidad mÃ­nima de tokens**.

[Stoner Cats](https://www.stonercats.com/), fue sin duda un **siguiente paso en token gating**, creando una serie de animaciÃ³n para adultos (creada por Mila Kunis y Ashton Kutcher). Para poder ver cada nuevo episodio de la serie, es necesario **ser titular de uno de los NFT** de Stoner Cats.

Los servicios token gated son especialmente **importantes** para los **creadores** y/o **marcas**, ya que les permiten centrarse en **ofrecer un buen servicio**, encontrar usuarios que quieran ese servicio, y centrarse en a**portar valor al usuario**. Esto es bueno para los usuarios, porque pueden **pagar menos y tener una mejor experiencia**. Es bueno para los creadores, porque pueden mantener sus negocios y **generar nuevas vÃ­as de monetizaciÃ³n** al mismo tiempo, **creando una comunidad**. 

Es un nuevo modelo para **crear una comunidad fiel** y darles **beneficios** por formar parte de ella. Hasta **Shopify** ha introducido **Tokengated Experiences** hace unas semanas:

[https://twitter.com/Shopify/status/1539610296200974338?s=20&t=LmgxEjqE4JFH2ZbfGTGLZw](https://twitter.com/Shopify/status/1539610296200974338?s=20&t=LmgxEjqE4JFH2ZbfGTGLZw)

### MÃ¡s allÃ¡ de un acceso restringido

Realmente, podemos ir mÃ¡s allÃ¡ con gated access, no tiene que quedarse en un link, es difÃ­cil de distribuir y no es tan fÃ¡cil monetizar de una manera directa. **Utilizarlo mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de un sistema de verificaciÃ³n, implementando-lo directamente en un NFT**. Dar v**alor intrÃ­nseco** al token aÃ±adiendo contenido restringido.

Un contenido exclusivo incrementa su valor en forma de NFT, pudiÃ©ndose vender directamente a una audiencia conservando todo el valor. Es como Patreon pero sin la plataforma, porque el **contenido puede vivir en cualquier lugar**. Es agnÃ³stico a una plataforma, el contenido estarÃ¡ donde tÃº elijas.

**Token gating es una forma de sobrecargar un NFT**, lo que otorga mÃ¡s valor a su propiedad. AdemÃ¡s de poseer el contenido de un video NFT, eBook NFT, Ticket NFT o Link NFT, tambiÃ©n puede garantizar que **solo sus propietarios puedan acceder** a ese contenido. Un ejemplo de ello fue mi presentaciÃ³n en ETHBarcelona, al acabar, todo el mundo que coleccionaba [mi NFT](https://tomu.mintgate.io/projects/cultura-tokenizada) tenia mi ppt gated, las diapositivas presentadas. Ese NFT no se ha quedado ahÃ­, cualquiera que lo coleccione **tendrÃ¡ acceso exclusivo a futuro contenido**. 

Convertir el contenido en un asset digital significa que se convierte en algo que el propietario puede revender. **No puedo revender mi suscripciÃ³n**, pero puedo **revender un video NFT** que comprÃ© la semana pasada por mÃ¡s de lo que me costÃ³, o incluso **prestarlo** mientras voy **generando un ingreso pasivo**.

### Comunidades web3

Esto es lo que hizo que toda comunidad tokenizada **tenga un sitio** donde **compartir** informaciÃ³n, tener un chat protegido solo para aquellos que tienen un **token en particular**. Hace dos veranos fue cuando [Collab.land](https://collab.land/) surgiÃ³ y domino los grupos de chat tanto en Telegram como en Discord. Cualquiera integraba sus servicios para crear un **canal exclusivo para holders**. Desde esos momentos, donde Collab.land se enfocaba en **chat** y MintGate en **contenido digital**, hemos visto que mÃ¡s y mÃ¡s plataformas han salido construyendo en este vertical. Si tengo que destacar dos de ellos, sin duda son:

* [Lit Protocol](https://litprotocol.com/) - Control de acceso descentralizado para aplicaciones web3 y datos privados en un Internet abierto.
* [Guild](https://guild.xyz/) - â€˜Token-enabled membershipâ€™. Puedes crear niveles exclusivos en tu comunidad y administrarlos con diferentes tokens.
